t: 2 Timothy 4
I*p charge thee therefore before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, who shall judge the quick and the dead at his appearing and his kingdom;
Preach*p the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.
For*p the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears;
And*p they shall turn away their ears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables.
But*p watch thou in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make full proof of thy ministry.
For*p I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.
I*p have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith:
Henceforth*p there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his appearing.
Do*p thy diligence to come shortly unto me:
For*p Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world, and is departed unto Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia.
Only*p Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with thee: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.
And*p Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.
The*p cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest, bring with thee, and the books, but especially the parchments.
Alexander*p the coppersmith did me much evil: the Lord reward him according to his works:
Of*p whom be thou ware also; for he hath greatly withstood our words.
At*p my first answer no man stood with me, but all men forsook me: I pray God that it may not be laid to their charge.
Notwithstanding*p the Lord stood with me, and strengthened me; that by me the preaching might be fully known, and that all the Gentiles might hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.
And*p the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve me unto his heavenly kingdom: to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
Salute*p Priscilla and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.
Erastus*p abode at Corinth: but Trophimus have I left at Miletus sick.
Do*p thy diligence to come before winter. Eubulus greeteth thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.
The*p Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
